title: Matchsafe, "Rolls Royce Radiator Grille", 1923–24
markings: An anchor, lion passant, and date letter ("y") are stamped on bezel. The lion passant and date letter ("y") are also stamped on inside of lid.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: In the form of a Rolls Royce radiator grille, with simulated perforations on front and reverse of body. The unadorned, canted lid displays car's logo, two overlapping R's in red enamel, on both front and reverse. At top of lid is a radiator cap. Lid hinged on side. Striker recessed in bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Rolls Royce Radiator Grille", 1923–24.
1923–24. Silver, enamel. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-98.
